title: Ella Toone heartbreak as dad dies just days before milestone
body_text:
Ella Toone's heartbreak as dad dies just days before milestone
The Lioness and Manchester United star paid tribute to her dad on Instagram
Ella Toone has revealed her dad has died just days before his 60th birthday.
The Lioness and Manchester United star, who is from Tyldesley, revealed the tragic news on her Instagram page as she paid tribute to the 'best dad in the world and her 'best friend'. The footballer said her dad Nick died just three days before he was due to celebrate his 60th birthday with his family, the Mirror reports.
She said he was the 'biggest reason' for her football achievements as she vowed to 'make him proud'. Taking to Instagram, Ella shared a string of snaps of her dad, alongside the caption: "Dad, Today would have been your 60th bday, just 3 days after we had to watch you leave us.

"I wish we could have had at least 20 more birthdays together. We will raise a glass for your big one tonight as much as you really didn’t wanna turn the big six 0!
"I don't have the words right now but all I can say is I will miss you and I will never stop loving you. There's a big hole in my heart that can never be filled but all I can do now is continue to make you proud.
"Your the biggest reason I've achieved what I have, playing without you sat in the stands shouting COME ON UNITED won't ever be the same but you got the best seat in the house now dad, just make sure you remember to take your glasses for once.
"The best dad in the world, best man, my best friend and my best football coach. We will stick together and we will make you proud Dad. 'Love you cock', 07/09/24. 59 forever."
Her brother, Joe Toone added: "Honoured to have called him my dad. He will be in our hearts forever sis." Ella replied: "Forever brother".
Ella's post received hundreds of comments and messages of support, with Lioness teammate Leah Williamson commenting a string of red hearts. Tanya Bardsley, who is married to Macclesfield assistant manager Phil Bardsley, also typed 'I'm so sorry for your loss' with crying emojis and red hearts.
Georgia Stanway wrote: "He'll always have the best seat in the house". England goalkeeper Mary Earps penned: "Sending you all the love in the world, you'll forever make him proud".
Manchester United fan Ellie Green shared an emotional statement on social media, writing: "Bloody loved him so much. Thank you Nick for always looking out for me at games, telling me your jokes.
"Making sure I have the best seats at games, remember when he gave me one of your VIP lanyards families get to wear at Lionesses games, you was such a great man. Made me feel at home straight away at United. You’ll never be forgotten, the Toone family sending all my love."
Ella plays as an attacking midfielder for Manchester United in the Women's Super League. She scored in England's final against Germany in June 2022 with the team winning the Women's Euro tournament.
